author: Ming Shengrong
notes: Ming Shengrong [明生荣]. 2007. A study of Bijie dialects [毕节方言研究]. China Sociology Publishing House [中国社会科学出版社].This dialect of Southwestern Mandarin is spoken in Bijie Prefecture (毕节市), Guizhou province, China. It is spoken by the Han, Miao, Buyi, Yi, and Gelao peoples. The tones are similar to those of many Southwestern Mandarin dialects of the Sichuan Basin.Apostrophes signify aspiration.
source: @book{Shengrong2007,  date          = {2007},  title_english = {A study of Bijie dialects},  title         = {毕节方言研究},  publisher     = {China Sociology Publishing House},  author        = {[明生荣], Ming Shengrong}}

author: fruit
glottocode: 水果 (not 树 'tree', which is su213)
